main event: A civilian observed a white, rectangular light that disappeared from view after about 3 minutes in Waterloo, Illinois on November 17, 1968.
interesting points: The object faded out gradually and made no sound.
The observer had seen similar phenomena before.
The weather conditions included surface winds from 315 degrees at 8 knots, with broken clouds at 1,200 feet and overcast at 3,000 feet.
The Air Force concluded the sighting was likely of a garment balloon due to the description and weather conditions.
The observer provided a detailed sketch and diagram of the sighting to aid in the investigation.
